docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 3 Three weeks ago, when W. Averell Harriman and Viscount Hailsham came to Moscow to start the negotiations that led to the treaty on a partial nuclear test ban, the Soviet Government was still playing host, although not very graciously, to a delegation from Communist China.

byline.original: By HENRY TANNER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP)  After a week of diplomatic soundings abroad, United States authorities are convinced that an overwhelming majority of nations favor the United States. British-Soviet test ban treaty to be signed in Moscow on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) After a week of diplomatic soundings abroad, United States authorities are convinced that an overwhelming majority of nations favor the United States. British-Soviet test ban treaty to be signed in Moscow on Monday.
docs.abstract: US survey finds 93 nations favor treaty, 3-5 opposed

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5  Broad dissension is developing within Latin-American Communist movements along the lines of the Soviet-Chinese quarrel, a country-by-country survey dis  closed today.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6-- Haiti accused the Dominican Republic today of helping prepare an invasion force of Haitian exiles that is attempting to overthrow the regime of President Francois Duvalier.

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 7-- A new electric power plant on a tiny stream in the vast desert of northern Chile will go into service late this year, adding new sparks to the dispute between Chile and Bolivia.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8-- Haiti pressed the Organization of American States today to seek the removal of Haitian exile leaders from the Dominican Republic.
